solution_line_template: A small knife is twice the amount of the utensils that costs ${utensils_cost} so the knife costs {knife_multiplier}*{utensils_cost} = $<<{knife_multiplier}*{utensils_cost}={knife_cost}>>{knife_cost}

All total, each little kit will costs ${hand_mitts_cost} for mitts, ${apron_cost} for an apron, ${utensils_cost} for utensils and ${knife_cost} for a knife for a total of {hand_mitts_cost}+{apron_cost}+{utensils_cost}+{knife_cost} = $<<{hand_mitts_cost}+{apron_cost}+{utensils_cost}+{knife_cost}={cost_per_kit_before_discount}>>{cost_per_kit_before_discount}

Each kit costs ${cost_per_kit_before_discount} and they are currently {discount_percent_num}% off so that's a savings of {cost_per_kit_before_discount}*{discount_percent_decimal} = $<<{cost_per_kit_before_discount}*{discount_percent_decimal}={discount_amount_per_kit}>>{discount_amount_per_kit}

The kits are ${cost_per_kit_before_discount} and they are ${discount_amount_per_kit} off so they now cost {cost_per_kit_before_discount}-{discount_amount_per_kit} = $<<{cost_per_kit_before_discount}-{discount_amount_per_kit}={cost_per_kit_after_discount}>>{cost_per_kit_after_discount}

She needs to buy {num_nieces} kits and each kit costs ${cost_per_kit_after_discount} so that's {num_nieces}*{cost_per_kit_after_discount} = $<<{num_nieces}*{cost_per_kit_after_discount}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
